All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Ball
Represents the ball used in the game, including its movement mechanics, collision detection, and resizing capabilities.
BallManager
Manages the ball's movements and collisions within the game.
DatabaseConnection
Handles the creation and management of database connections.
DatabaseManager
Manages database operations related to game data.
Game
Represents the entire game state for a Ping-Pong game.
GameBuilder
Builder class for creating Game objects.
GameController
Controls the flow and logic of the game, coordinating interactions between the model and the view.
GameDAO
Data Access Object (DAO) for handling game persistence operations.
GameMenu
The GameMenu class is responsible for creating and managing the user interface for the game menu.
GameSaver
Singleton class responsible for saving and loading game settings to and from files.
GameSettings
Stores and manages all settings for a Ping-Pong game.
GameView
Handles the graphical representation of the Ping Pong game.
HeapStackTest
A utility class for testing and understanding the behavior of Java memory management, specifically focusing on heap and stack size limits.
IGameDAO
Interface for data access object to handle database operations for Game objects.
KeyboardListener
Handles keyboard events for the game, enabling player control over their rackets using the keyboard.
MenuListener
Handles menu interactions and manages game control functions such as starting, pausing, and exiting the game.
PingPongGame
The main application class for the Ping Pong game.
Player
Represents a player in the game.
Racket
Represents a racket in the game.
Resizable
Interface defining resizable components in the game, allowing them to adjust their size dynamically based on a given factor.
SceneToScene
Interface defining navigation between different scenes in the application, such as moving from the game scene to the menu scene.
